results.title: Ingredients of an effective speech
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Ingredients of a speech’ addresses speaking rate, volume, voice projection, use of light and shade and the use of pausing for delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Ingmar Bergman
results.creator_credit: Stattan Hedqvist, Svenska filminstitutet and Stig Bjorkman
results.brief_description: Ingmar Bergman is widely acknowledged by film critics as adopting an intellectual stance towards film making, as well as being one of the great directors of actors. This documentary includes clips from his films and indicates his working relationships with actors. The film also brings out the requirements involved in being a film director. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Inflation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
A review of inflation covering a definition of terms, general and specific causes and measurement. Understanding this topic is a basic requirement for further study in the area of unemployment and prices policy.

results.title: Infinite journey
results.brief_description: Man’s historical aspiration to reach the moon and the world’s involvement in the Apollo 11 flight are the themes of this film, which are placed in the context of the historical aspiration and scientific genius of many lands which made them possible. Also focuses on the Gemini flights. Introduced by Richard Nixon and narrated by Gregory Peck.

results.title: Infertility
results.brief_description: Introduced by Professor Carl Wood, this program looks at the various causes of infertility in humans. The documentary is presented in a simple manner and is designed to give basic information to couples who are having trouble conceiving. The sequel is titled, “The Alternatives to Infertility”.

results.title: Infectious diseases and natural body defenses
results.brief_description: Uses photomicrography, laboratory demonstration, and animation to illustrate the two groups of natural body defences which guard the body against disease. Explains the outer body defences including the skin, passages of the nose and throat, and stomach acids. Among the inner body defences are lymph glands, the chemical antibodies, spleen, liver and while blood cells.

results.title: Infectious diseases and man-made defences
results.brief_description: Some of the causes of infectious diseases and how we use man-made defences to protect ourselves. How antitoxins, vaccines, antibiotics and synthetic drugs are produced and used to help active and passive immunity in the body.

results.title: Infant dance (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Wolverhampton Education Committee and Educational Foundation for Visual Aids
results.brief_description: A class of 6-7 year olds is observed performing spontaneous dance movements, movements inspired by suggestions from the teacher, and by short rhythms played on percussion instruments. Individual children are studied in closer detail.

results.title: Infant cognition (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Personality and Learning”.
An exploration of the development of the bond between mother and her baby. Using special filming technique it analyses sequences of what is known as per-speech, a recently discovered phenomenon where babies, even of a few days old, take part in adult-type conversations with their mothers.
